answerText: apical meristems [prompt on partial answer] [10] Apical meristems can differentiate into procambium, which can develop into the primary form of this transport tissue responsible for transport of organic nutrients. It is believed that its sap flows via the pressure flow hypothesis.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | UC San Diego and Washington University and Chicago B | 20 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: It consists of a tunica and a corpus.  [10] Name these growing tips, undifferentiated tissue which drive growth of shoots and roots.
